sen.j: 中山道（なかせんどう）は、江戸時代の五街道の一つで、本州中部の内陸側を経由する路線である。
sen.e: Nakasen-do Road was one of the Go-kaido Road (the five major roads) of the Edo Period which ran through the interior of the central Honshu area.
Nakasen-do Road was one of the Go-kaido Road (the five major roads) of the Edo Period which ran through the interior of the central Honshu area.
Nakasen-do Road (中山道) was one of the Go-kaido Road (the five major roads) of the Edo Period which ran through the interior of the central Honshu area.
sen.cmt: 次の文章に別の漢字表記があるので、追加しました。

sen.j: 「中仙道」とも表記する。
sen.e: It is also written as中仙道 in kanji.
It is also written as中仙道 in kanji.
It is also written as中仙道 in kanji.

sen.j: 東海道に次ぐ主要街道であった。
sen.e: Nakasen-do Road was the major route after Tokai-do Road.
Nakasen-do Road was the major route after Tokai-do Road.
Nakasen-do Road was the major route after Tokai-do Road.

sen.j: 江戸の日本橋 (東京都中央区)から草津宿まで。
sen.e: It runs from Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) in Edo to Kusatsu-juku Station.
It runs from Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) in Edo to Kusatsu-juku Station.
It runs from Nihonbashi (Chuo Ward, Tokyo) in Edo to Kusatsu-juku.

sen.j: 草津宿で東海道に合流する。
sen.e: Nakasen-do Road merges with Tokai-do Road at Kusatsu-juku Station.
Nakasen-do Road merges with Tokai-do Road at Kusatsu-juku Station.
Nakasen-do Road merges with Tokai-do Road at Kusatsu-juku.

sen.j: 江戸から草津までは129里あり、67箇所の宿場が置かれた。
sen.e: There were 507km and 67 stations between Edo and Kusatsu.
There were 507km and 67 stations between Edo and Kusatsu.
There were 507km and 67 stations between Edo and Kusatsu.

sen.j: 現在の都府県では、東京都・埼玉県・群馬県・長野県・岐阜県・滋賀県にあたる。
sen.e: In terms of the present prefectures, Nakasen-do Road goes through Tokyo, Saitama, Gunma, Nagano, Gifu and Shiga.

sen.j: 律令制
sen.e: The Ritsuryo System
The Ritsuryo System
The Ritsuryo System

sen.j: 律令時代には、畿内を中心とした地方区分であった。
sen.e: During the Ritsuryo Era in Japan, the land was divided into various regions with the Kinai district (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) being the center of the country.

During the Ritsuryo Era in Japan, the land was divided into various regions with the Kinai district (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) being the center of the country.

During the Ritsuryo Era in Japan, the land was divided into various regions with the Kinai region (the five capital provinces surrounding the ancient capitals of Nara and Kyoto) being the center of the country.
sen.cmt: 「畿内」の訳を用語集に合わせて変更

sen.j: そのため、東山道は畿内から東の内陸部に伸びる道路として整備された。
sen.e: Tosan-do Road was consequently developed to stretch from the Kinai district to the eastern inland area.
Tosan-do Road was consequently developed to stretch from the Kinai district to the eastern inland area.
Tosan-do Road was consequently developed to stretch from the Kinai region to the eastern inland area.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)
sen.e: The Sengoku Period (Japan)
The Sengoku Period (Japan)
Sengoku Period (period of warring states in Japan)
sen.cmt: 戦国時代の定義を追加

sen.j: 戦国時代の東山道は、武田氏（甲斐国）や小笠原氏（信濃国）や金森氏（飛騨国）や織田氏（美濃国）などの地盤であった。
sen.e: During the Sengoku Period, the areas along Tosan-do Road were power base of various feudal lords such as theTakeda clan (Kai Province), the clan (Shinano Province), the Kanamori clan (Hida Province) and the Oda clan (Mino Province).

During the Sengoku Period, the areas along Tosan-do Road were power base of various feudal lords such as theTakeda clan (Kai Province), the clan (Shinano Province), the Kanamori clan (Hida Province) and the Oda clan (Mino Province).

During the Sengoku Period, the areas along Tosan-do Road were power base of various feudal lords such as theTakeda clan (Kai Province), the Ogasawara clan (Shinano Province), the Kanamori clan (Hida Province) and the Oda clan (Mino Province).

sen.j: このため、武田氏や織田氏を中心とする軍勢などによって、東山道と東海道を結ぶ連絡線が整備された。
sen.e: The communication route connecting Tosan-do Road and Tokai-do Road were hence developed by the concerned parties including the troops of the Takeda clan and the Oda clan.
The communication route connecting Tosan-do Road and Tokai-do Road were hence developed by the concerned parties including the troops of the Takeda clan and the Oda clan.
The communication route connecting Tosan-do Road and Tokai-do Road were hence developed by the concerned parties including the troops of the Takeda clan and the Oda clan.

sen.j: この連絡線は、現在の国道52号、国道151号・国道153号、国道22号などの源流となった。
sen.e: The present national highways 52, 151 and 22 were originally part of this communication route.
The present national highways 52, 151 and 22 were originally part of this communication route.
The present national highways 52, 151 and 22 were originally part of this communication route.

sen.j: 1600年（慶長8年）、宇都宮市から関ヶ原の戦いへ向かう徳川秀忠の軍勢が中山道を通っている。
sen.e: In 1600, the troops led by Hidetada TOKUGAWA traveled on Nakasen-do Road from Utsunomiya City to participate in the Battle of Sekigahara.
In 1600, the troops led by Hidetada TOKUGAWA traveled on Nakasen-do Road from Utsunomiya City to participate in the Battle of Sekigahara.
In 1600, the troops led by Hidetada TOKUGAWA traveled on Nakasen-do Road from Utsunomiya City to participate in the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: この際真田昌幸が守る上田城を攻略できず、足止めされ関ヶ原の戦いに遅参するという失態を起こした。
sen.e: On that occasion, Hidetada was held up at Ueda-jo Castle which was successfully defended by Masayuki SANADA and, as a result, fell from grace by arriving late at Sekigahara for the battle.
On that occasion, Hidetada was held up at Ueda-jo Castle which was successfully defended by Masayuki SANADA and, as a result, fell from grace by arriving late at Sekigahara for the battle.
On that occasion, Hidetada was held up at Ueda-jo Castle which was successfully defended by Masayuki SANADA and, as a result, fell from grace by arriving late at Sekigahara for the battle.

sen.j: 江戸時代
sen.e: Edo Period
Edo Period
Edo Period

sen.j: 江戸時代に入り、江戸幕府は、1601年（慶長6年）から7年間で他の五街道とともに中山道を整備した。
sen.e: With the dawning of the Edo Period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) completed the development of Nakasen-do Road along with the other 5 highways in 7 years from the commencement of the project in 1601.

With the dawning of the Edo Period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) completed the development of Nakasen-do Road along with the other 5 highways in 7 years from the commencement of the project in 1601.

With the dawning of the Edo Period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) completed the development of Nakasen-do Road along with the other five highways in seven years from the commencement of the project in 1601.

sen.j: それまでの街道を改良したものが多かったが、新しく作られた街道筋もあった（大井宿（岐阜県恵那市） - 御嶽宿（岐阜県可児郡御嵩町）間など）。
sen.e: During this project, there were many areas where improvements were made to the existing highways to use as part of Nakasen-do Road but there were some roads (such as the route between Oi-juku (Ena City, Gifu Prefecture) and Mitake-juku (Mitake-cho, Kani-gun, Gifu Prefecture)) that were newly developed.

During this project, there were many areas where improvements were made to the existing highways to use as part of Nakasen-do Road but there were some roads (such as the route between Oi-juku (Ena City, Gifu Prefecture) and Mitake-juku (Mitake-cho, Kani-gun, Gifu Prefecture)) that were newly developed.

During this project, there were many areas where improvements were made to the existing highways but there were some roads (such as the route between Oi-juku (Ena City, Gifu Prefecture) and Mitake-juku (Mitake-cho, Kani-gun, Gifu Prefecture)) that were newly developed.
sen.cmt: 「to use as part of Nakasen-do Road」の部分を削除

sen.j: 古くは山道や東山道とも称され、江戸時代には中山道や中仙道とも表記されたが、1716年（正徳6年）に、江戸幕府の通達により中山道に統一された。
sen.e: In ancient days, Nakasen-do Road was referred to as mountain pass or Tosan-do Road and, during the Edo Period, either the kanji representing 'mountain' or 'mountain' with personal radical at the right hand side was used for 'sen' which is situated in the middle of the 3 kanji characters that make up the word Nakasen-do but, in 1716, it was standardized with the 'mountain' character as per instruction of the Edo bakufu.

In ancient days, Nakasen-do Road was referred to as mountain pass or Tosan-do Road and, during the Edo Period, either the kanji representing 'mountain' or 'mountain' with personal radical at the right hand side was used for 'sen' which is situated in the middle of the 3 kanji characters that make up the word Nakasen-do but, in 1716, it was standardized with the 'mountain' character as per instruction of the Edo bakufu.

In ancient days, Nakasen-do Road was referred to as mountain pass or Tosan-do Road and, during the Edo Period, it was written as 中山道 or 中仙道 but, in 1716, it was standardized to 中山道 as per the instruction of the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: ファイルいの最初に漢字表記しているので、漢字表記に変更しました。

sen.j: 関所は、上野国碓氷峠（群馬県安中市）、信濃国福島宿（長野県木曽郡木曽町）、信濃国贄川宿（長野県塩尻市）の三箇所に設置された。
sen.e: Sekisho (checkpoint) was installed at 3 locations including Usui-toge Pass in Kozuke Province (Annaka City, Gunma Prefecture), Fukushima-juku (Kiso-machi, Kiso Gun, Nagano Prefecture) and Niekawa-juku (Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture) in Shinano Province.

Sekisho (checkpoint) was installed at 3 locations including Usui-toge Pass in Kozuke Province (Annaka City, Gunma Prefecture), Fukushima-juku (Kiso-machi, Kiso Gun, Nagano Prefecture) and Niekawa-juku (Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture) in Shinano Province.

Sekisho (checkpoint) was installed at 3 locations including Usui-toge Pass in Kozuke Province (Annaka City, Gunma Prefecture), Fukushima-juku (Kiso-machi, Kiso Gun, Nagano Prefecture) and Niekawa-juku (Shiojiri City, Nagano Prefecture) in Shinano Province.

sen.j: 明治時代以降
sen.e: The Meiji Era and Later
The Meiji Era and Later
Meiji Era and Later
sen.cmt: 冠詞を他の時代とそろえて削除

sen.j: 明治中期以降、鉄道網の発達により、東京と京都を結ぶ街道としての中山道は次第に衰退していった。
sen.e: Since the mid-Meiji Era, due to the advancement of railway system, Nakasen-do Road as a highway connecting Tokyo and Kyoto began its gradual decline.
Since the mid-Meiji Era, due to the advancement of railway system, Nakasen-do Road as a highway connecting Tokyo and Kyoto began its gradual decline.
Since the mid-Meiji Era, due to the advancement of railway system, Nakasen-do Road as a highway connecting Tokyo and Kyoto began its gradual decline.

sen.j: ただし、中山道のそれぞれの部分は、「東京と新潟を結ぶ街道（東京～高崎）」「尾張と木曾を結ぶ街道（名古屋～長野）」などとして、依然として重要な街道であり続けた。
sen.e: Respective segments of Nakasen-do Road, however, remained important highways such as the 'route between Tokyo and Niigata (Tokyo – Takasaki)' and 'route between Owari and Kiso (Nagoya – Nagano).
Respective segments of Nakasen-do Road, however, remained important highways such as the 'route between Tokyo and Niigata (Tokyo – Takasaki)' and 'route between Owari and Kiso (Nagoya – Nagano).
Some segments of Nakasen-do Road, however, remained important highways such as the 'route between Tokyo and Niigata (Tokyo – Takasaki)' and 'route between Owari and Kiso (Nagoya – Nagano)'.

sen.j: 中山道幹線
sen.e: Nakasen-do Main Line
Nakasen-do Main Line
Nakasen-do Main Line

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）、明治政府により東京市～京都市の両市を結ぶ鉄道建設計画が発表された。
sen.e: In 1869, the Meiji Government announced a construction project for the railroad between Tokyo and Kyoto.
In 1869, the Meiji Government announced a construction project for the railroad between Tokyo and Kyoto.
In 1869, the Meiji Government announced a construction project for the railroad between Tokyo and Kyoto.

sen.j: 明治政府は、東西を結び国家建設の中核となる鉄道建設を計画した。
sen.e: The Meiji Government had a plan to construct a railroad which would play a central role in building the country by connecting east and west.
The Meiji Government had a plan to construct a railroad which would play a central role in building the country by connecting east and west.
The Meiji Government had a plan to construct a railroad which would play a central role in building the country by connecting east and west.

sen.j: しかし、その路線の選定では東海道ルートと中山道ルートの両案が並立し、長期間決定されなかった。
sen.e: The decision process to select the route, however, became locked in a long stalemate between the 2 proposals; the Tokai-do route and Nakasen-do route.
The decision process to select the route, however, became locked in a long stalemate between the 2 proposals; the Tokai-do route and Nakasen-do route.
The decision process to select the route, however, became locked in a long stalemate between the two proposals: the Tokai-do route and Nakasen-do route.
sen.cmt: 数字のスペルアウトセミコロン→コロン

sen.j: その間に、中山道沿線では私鉄の日本鉄道による建設が進んでいた。
sen.e: In the meantime, the private railroad company Nippon Railway was proceeding with construction along Nakasen-do.
In the meantime, the private railroad company Nippon Railway was proceeding with construction along Nakasen-do.
In the meantime, the private railroad company Nippon Railway was proceeding with construction along Nakasen-do.

sen.j: 1883年（明治16年）7月28日、上野駅～熊谷駅間などが開業。
sen.e: On July 28, 1833, some lines such as the service between Ueno Station and Kumagaya Station began their operation.
On July 28, 1833, some lines such as the service between Ueno Station and Kumagaya Station began their operation.
On July 28, 1833, some lines such as the service between Ueno Station and Kumagaya Station began their operation.

sen.j: 翌1884年には上野～高崎駅間が開通した。
sen.e: The line between Ueno and Takasaki stations was open in the following 1884.
The line between Ueno and Takasaki stations was open in the following 1884.
The line between Ueno and Takasaki stations was opened in the following 1884.

sen.j: 同年12月、政府は「中山道鉄道建設公債」を発行し、東西の幹線鉄道は中山道ルートで建設すると決定した。
sen.e: In December of that year, having reached the decision to construct the east-west main line along the Nakasen-do corridor, the government issued the Nakasen-do Railroad Development Bond.
In December of that year, having reached the decision to construct the east-west main line along the Nakasen-do corridor, the government issued the Nakasen-do Railroad Development Bond.
In December of that year, having reached the decision to construct the east-west main line along the Nakasen-do corridor, the government issued the Nakasen-do Railroad Development Bond.

sen.j: これは、東海道ルートで建設した場合、既に海運が発達していたために競争となって運賃の高い鉄道は不利であり、逆に山沿いで建設すれば新たな地域開発も図れるという点から決定されたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that this decision was made based on the various factors such as that the Tokai-do route would put the railway in unfavorable competition against the already developed and cheaper marine transport, whereas, building the railway along the mountains could lead to a plan for the new regional development in those areas.

It is said that this decision was made based on the various factors such as that the Tokai-do route would put the railway in unfavorable competition against the already developed and cheaper marine transport, whereas, building the railway along the mountains could lead to a plan for the new regional development in those areas.

It is said that this decision was made based on the various factors such as that the Tokai-do route would put the railway in unfavorable competition against the already developed and cheaper marine transport, whereas, building the railway along the mountains could lead to a plan for the new regional development in those areas.

sen.j: 一説には、戦時における海からの攻撃に対する脆弱性を懸念する軍部の山縣有朋が1883年（明治16年）に「鉄道は山側に敷設すべき」と主張したことから、このようなルートが採用されたとするものもある。
sen.e: According to one account, the Nakasen-do route was selected based on the argument put forward by Aritomo YAMAGATA of the Imperial Japanese Army in 1883 that the railroad had to be built along the mountains out of concern for the vulnerability of the railway lines built along the coast against the enemy attack from the sea in wartime.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to one account, the Nakasen-do route was selected based on the argument put forward by Aritomo YAMAGATA of the Imperial Japanese Army in 1883 that the railroad had to be built along the mountains out of concern for the vulnerability of the railway lines built along the coast against the enemy attack from the sea in wartime.

According to one account, the Nakasen-do route was selected based on the argument put forward by Aritomo YAMAGATA of the Imperial Japanese Army in 1883 that the railroad had to be built along the mountains out of concern for the vulnerability of the railway lines built along the coast against the enemy attack from the sea in wartime.

sen.j: 実際には前述のような事情のため、山縣の主張以前に当時国有鉄道を管轄していた工部省鉄道局が、このルートの採用を決めていたと思われている。
sen.e: However, it is considered that, based on the circumstances surrounding the inevitable competition against marine transport as mentioned earlier, the Railway Bureau of Kobusho (the Ministry of Industry) having jurisdiction over the Japanese National Railways in those days had, in fact, already decided on this route prior to Yamagata's argument.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, it is considered that, based on the circumstances surrounding the inevitable competition against marine transport as mentioned earlier, the Railway Bureau of Kobusho (the Ministry of Industry) having jurisdiction over the Japanese National Railways in those days had, in fact, already decided on this route prior to Yamagata's argument.

However, it is considered that, based on the circumstances surrounding the inevitable competition against marine transport as mentioned earlier, the Railway Bureau of Kobusho (the Ministry of Industry) having jurisdiction over the Japanese National Railways in those days had, in fact, already decided on this route prior to Yamagata's argument.

sen.j: 更に、当時の日本の主力輸出産品であった生糸の主産地である群馬県や長野県を通ることで、産業振興に重要な役割を果たせるという期待もあった。
sen.e: Additionally, with the railway going through Gunma and Nagano prefectures, the production areas of silk which was one of Japan's major exports in those days, it was expected that the Nakasen-do route could play a key role in industrial development of the country.

Additionally, with the railway going through Gunma and Nagano prefectures, the production areas of silk which was one of Japan's major exports in those days, it was expected that the Nakasen-do route could play a key role in industrial development of the country.

Additionally, with the railway going through Gunma and Nagano prefectures, the production areas of silk which was one of Japan's major exports in those days, it was expected that the Nakasen-do route could play a key role in industrial development of the country.

sen.j: また、東西幹線の通過しない地域の振興も図るため、多くの支線（軽井沢駅～直江津駅、岐阜駅～武豊駅、米原駅～敦賀駅など）も設置することになっていた。
sen.e: It was also envisaged that a number of branch lines (including the lines between Karuizawa and Naoetsu, Gifu and Taketoyo in addition to Maibara and Tsuruga) be installed to develop areas outside the east-west main line corridor.

It was also envisaged that a number of branch lines (including the lines between Karuizawa and Naoetsu, Gifu and Taketoyo in addition to Maibara and Tsuruga) be installed to develop areas outside the east-west main line corridor.

It was also envisaged that a number of branch lines (including the lines between Karuizawa and Naoetsu, Gifu and Taketoyo in addition to Maibara and Tsuruga) be installed to develop areas outside the east-west main line corridor.

sen.j: この決定に従い、日本国有鉄道の手で中山道幹線本線やその支線（資材運搬用）の建設が進んだ。
sen.e: The Japanese National Railways moved ahead with construction of the Nakasen-do Main Line and the related branch lines (to transport materials) acccording to the foregoing decision.
The Japanese National Railways moved ahead with construction of the Nakasen-do Main Line and the related branch lines (to transport materials) acccording to the foregoing decision.
The Japanese National Railways moved ahead with construction of the Nakasen-do Main Line and the related branch lines (to transport materials) according to the foregoing decision.

sen.j: この時期の開業は以下の通りである。
sen.e: Opening date of the various lines during this period has been listed as follows:
Opening date of the various lines during this period has been listed as follows:
Opening date of the various lines during this period has been listed as follows:

sen.j: 1882年3月10日、支線部分：長浜駅－柳ヶ瀬間、洞道口（仮）（後の洞道西口）－金ヶ崎（現在の敦賀港駅）間（注：東西幹線ルート決定前の開業）
sen.e: March 10, 1882, the segments of the branch line opened between Nagahama Station and Yanagase and between Todoguchi (as temporarily called) (later renamed to Todonishiguchi) and Kanegasaki (the present Tsugaminato Station).

March 10, 1882, the segments of the branch line opened between Nagahama Station and Yanagase and between Todoguchi (as temporarily called) (later renamed to Todonishiguchi) and Kanegasaki (the present Tsugaminato Station).

March 10, 1882, the segments of the branch line between Nagahama Station and Yanagase and between Todoguchi (as temporarily called) (later renamed to Todonishiguchi) and Kanegasaki (the present Tsugaminato Station) were opened.

sen.j: 1884年4月16日、支線部分：柳ヶ瀬－洞道西口（仮）間
sen.e: April 16, 1884, the segment of the branch line opened between Yanagase and Todonishiguchi (temporarily named).
April 16, 1884, the segment of the branch line opened between Yanagase and Todonishiguchi (temporarily named).
April 16, 1884, the segment of the branch line between Yanagase and Todonishiguchi (temporarily named) was opened.

sen.j: 1884年5月25日、支線部分：大垣駅－長浜間（東海道線全通時に一部廃止）
sen.e: May 25, 1884, the segment of the branch line between Ogaki Station and Nagahama (part of which became discontinued when the entire Tokaido Line opened was open) opened.
May 25, 1884, the segment of the branch line between Ogaki Station and Nagahama (part of which became discontinued when the entire Tokaido Line opened was open) opened.
May 25, 1884, the segment of the branch line between Ogaki Station and Nagahama (part of which became discontinued when the entire Tokaido Line was opened) was opened.

sen.j: 1885年10月15日、本線部分：高崎－横川駅 (群馬県)間
sen.e: October 15, 1885, the segment of the main line opened between Takasaki and Yokokawa (Gunma Prefecture).
October 15, 1885, the segment of the main line opened between Takasaki and Yokokawa (Gunma Prefecture).
October 15, 1885, the segment of the main line between Takasaki and Yokokawa (Gunma Prefecture) was opened.

sen.j: 1886年3月1日、支線部分：武豊駅－大府駅－熱田駅間
sen.e: March 1, 1886, the segment of the branch line connecting Taketoyo Station and Atsuta Station with a stop at Obu Station was opened.
March 1, 1886, the segment of the branch line connecting Taketoyo Station and Atsuta Station with a stop at Obu Station was opened.
March 1, 1886, the segment of the branch line connecting Taketoyo Station and Atsuta Station with a stop at Obu Station was opened.

sen.j: 1886年4月25日、支線部分：熱田－大垣駅間（武豊－敦賀－金ヶ崎間開通）
sen.e: April 25, 1886, the segment of the branch connecting Atsuta and Ogaki Station (which ran between Taketoyo and Kanegasaki with a stop at Tsuruga was opened.
April 25, 1886, the segment of the branch connecting Atsuta and Ogaki Station (which ran between Taketoyo and Kanegasaki with a stop at Tsuruga was opened.
April 25, 1886, the segment of the branch line connecting Atsuta and Ogaki Station (which ran between Taketoyo and Kanegasaki with a stop at Tsuruga) was opened.
sen.cmt: branch→branch lineに変更かっこを追加

sen.j: 1886年7月19日、明治政府は東西幹線ルートを東海道に変更すると決定。
sen.e: July 19, 1886, the Meiji Government decided to change the east-west main line route to that ran along Tokai-do Road.
July 19, 1886, the Meiji Government decided to change the east-west main line route to that ran along Tokai-do Road.
July 19, 1886, the Meiji Government decided to change the east-west main line route to that ran along Tokai-do Road.

sen.j: 実際に測量が開始され、一部では建設にも着手したが、碓氷峠などの山越えが予想以上に険しく、工事の長期化や費用増、開業後の輸送力制限などが避けられなくなった。
sen.e: In fact, survey began and construction started in some areas but mountainous terrains such as Usui-toge Pass presented more serious challenge than anticipated whereby various setbacks such as work delays, cost overrun and transport capacity restriction after the opening became inevitable.

In fact, survey began and construction started in some areas but mountainous terrains such as Usui-toge Pass presented more serious challenge than anticipated whereby various setbacks such as work delays, cost overrun and transport capacity restriction after the opening became inevitable.

In fact, survey began and construction started in some areas but mountainous terrains such as Usui-toge Pass presented more serious challenge than anticipated thereby various setbacks such as work delays, cost overrun and transport capacity restriction after the opening became inevitable.

sen.j: そこで、産業革命の進展や国際情勢の緊迫化などで東西幹線の早期完成や輸送力強化が求められるようになった。
sen.e: With the intensifying industrial revolution and tense international affairs, early completion of the East-West Main Line and increased carrying capacity became necessary.
With the intensifying industrial revolution and tense international affairs, early completion of the East-West Main Line and increased carrying capacity became necessary.
With the intensifying industrial revolution and tense international affairs, early completion of the East-West Main Line and increased carrying capacity became necessary.

sen.j: また、このルートで通過しない大都市である名古屋の市長は市の衰退を憂慮し、国へ東海道ルートへの変更を求めて働きかけを行っていた。
sen.e: As the main line did not go through Nagoya, the mayor of that major city became concerned about the possibility of its eventual decline without access to the railroad service whereby starting to work with the government to change the route to the Tokai-do plan.

As the main line did not go through Nagoya, the mayor of that major city became concerned about the possibility of its eventual decline without access to the railroad service whereby starting to work with the government to change the route to the Tokai-do plan.

As the main line did not go through Nagoya, the mayor of that major city became concerned about the possibility of its eventual decline without access to the railroad service thereby starting to work with the government to change the route to the Tokai-do plan.

sen.j: そこで、一部を除けば比較的平坦で、当時の技術水準でも早期完成が可能な東海道ルートに変更し、1890年の帝国議会開設に間に合うように至急工事が行われることになった。
sen.e: The main line was consequently changed to the Tokai-do route where terrains were relatively flat for the most part making it possible to complete the construction quickly even with the level of technology of the time and the work immediately got underway to finish the project in time for inauguration of the Imperial Diet in 1890.

The main line was consequently changed to the Tokai-do route where terrains were relatively flat for the most part making it possible to complete the construction quickly even with the level of technology of the time and the work immediately got underway to finish the project in time for inauguration of the Imperial Diet in 1890.

The main line was consequently changed to the Tokai-do route where the terrain was relatively flat for the most part making it possible to complete the construction quickly even with the level of technology of the time, and the work immediately got underway to finish the project in time for the inauguration of the Imperial Diet in 1890.
sen.cmt: カンマを追加terrains→the terrainに変更

sen.j: 1889年7月1日、東海道本線新橋（後の汐留）～神戸駅 (兵庫県)間が全通。
sen.e: July 1, 1889, the entire length of the Tokaido Main Line between Shimbashi (which subsequently became referred to as Shiodome) and Kobe Station (Hyogo Prefecture) was open.
July 1, 1889, the entire length of the Tokaido Main Line between Shimbashi (which subsequently became referred to as Shiodome) and Kobe Station (Hyogo Prefecture) was open.
July 1, 1889, the entire length of the Tokaido Main Line between Shimbashi (which subsequently became referred to as Shiodome) and Kobe Station (Hyogo Prefecture) was open.

sen.j: 中山道幹線として建設された部分では、本線の西側部分になる大垣～草津～京都間と、支線の大府～大垣間が東海道線として組み込まれた。
sen.e: Of the railway segments constructed as part of the Nakasen-do Main Line, the line connecting Ogaki and Kyoto via Kusatsu which made up the western part of the Nakasen-do route and the branch line connecting Obu and Ogaki were incorporated into the Tokai-do Line.

Of the railway segments constructed as part of the Nakasen-do Main Line, the line connecting Ogaki and Kyoto via Kusatsu which made up the western part of the Nakasen-do route and the branch line connecting Obu and Ogaki were incorporated into the Tokai-do Line.

Of the railway segments constructed as part of the Nakasen-do Main Line, the line connecting Ogaki and Kyoto via Kusatsu which made up the western part of the Nakasen-do route and the branch line connecting Obu and Ogaki were incorporated into the Tokai-do Line.

sen.j: 支線のうち、武豊～大府間は東海道線の支線となり、その後1909年に武豊線となった。
sen.e: Of the branch lines, the line between Taketoyo and Obu became a branch line of the Tokai-do Line which subsequently became the Taketoyo Line in 1909.
Of the branch lines, the line between Taketoyo and Obu became a branch line of the Tokai-do Line which subsequently became the Taketoyo Line in 1909.
Of the branch lines, the line between Taketoyo and Obu became a branch line of the Tokai-do Line which subsequently became the Taketoyo Line in 1909.

sen.j: 1890年11月25日、第一回帝国議会（第一議会）が召集された。
sen.e: November 25, 1890, the inaugural Imperial Diet (the first session) was convened.
November 25, 1890, the inaugural Imperial Diet (the first session) was convened.
November 25, 1890, the inaugural Imperial Diet (the first session) was convened.

sen.j: 東海道線開通以後
sen.e: After the opening of the Tokai-do Line
After the opening of the Tokai-do Line
After the opening of the Tokai-do Line

sen.j: 東海道線の全通により、中山道はその任務を大きく変えることになった。
sen.e: The coming of the Tokai-do Line thereafter had a significant impact on the role of Nakasen-do Road.
The coming of the Tokai-do Line thereafter had a significant impact on the role of Nakasen-do Road.
The coming of the Tokai-do Line thereafter had a significant impact on the role of Nakasen-do Road.

sen.j: 明治維新で成立した中央集権体制で、名古屋市が地方支配の拠点にされて以降、名古屋を中心とする放射状交通網が整備され、「内陸同士」「沿岸同士」の連帯が壊されてしまった。
sen.e: Since Nagoya City was designated as the center of regional administration based on the centralized administrative framework as established during the Meiji Restoration, a spokewise transportation network was developed with that city being its hub whereby breaking down the sense of camaraderie among fellow municipalities in the interior or on the coast.

Since Nagoya City was designated as the center of regional administration based on the centralized administrative framework as established during the Meiji Restoration, a spokewise transportation network was developed with that city being its hub whereby breaking down the sense of camaraderie among fellow municipalities in the interior or on the coast.

Since Nagoya City was designated as the center of regional administration based on the centralized administrative framework as established during the Meiji Restoration, a spokewheel transportation network was developed with that city being its hub thereby breaking down the sense of camaraderie among fellow municipalities in the interior or on the coast.

sen.j: 加納宿（岐阜市加納）以西の中山道ルートには、太平洋沿岸に当たる三重県の鈴鹿山脈を越える本来の東海道に代わって、新たに東海道線が敷設された。
sen.e: Along the Nakasen-do corridor to the west of Kano-juku (Kano, Gifu City), the Tokai-do Line was newly constructed replacing the original Tokai-do Road which crossed over the Suzuka mountain range in Mie Prefecture on the Pacific coast.

Along the Nakasen-do corridor to the west of Kano-juku (Kano, Gifu City), the Tokai-do Line was newly constructed replacing the original Tokai-do Road which crossed over the Suzuka mountain range in Mie Prefecture on the Pacific coast.

Along the Nakasen-do corridor to the west of Kano-juku (Kano, Gifu City), the Tokai-do Line was newly constructed replacing the original Tokai-do Road which crossed over the Suzuka mountain range in Mie Prefecture on the Pacific coast.

sen.j: そして戦後には、岐阜以西の中山道ルートには、名神高速道路や東海道新幹線が敷設され、東西の幹線の表道となった。
sen.e: After the World War 2, in addition, the Meishin Expressway and Tokaido Shinkansen were built along the Nakasen-do corridor to the west of Gifu to play the key role in connecting east and west.
After the World War 2, in addition, the Meishin Expressway and Tokaido Shinkansen were built along the Nakasen-do corridor to the west of Gifu to play the key role in connecting east and west.
After World War II, in addition, the Meishin Expressway and Tokaido Shinkansen were built along the Nakasen-do corridor to the west of Gifu to play the key role in connecting east and west.

sen.j: 岐阜駅以東の中山道ルートには、概ね高山本線・太多線・中央本線・信越本線・高崎線などが整備された。
sen.e: Various railway lines such as Takayama Line, Taita Line, Chuo Main Line, Shinetsu Main Line and Takasaki Line have been built along the Nakasen-do route to the west of Gifu Station for the most part.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Various railway lines such as Takayama Line, Taita Line, Chuo Main Line, Shinetsu Main Line and Takasaki Line have been built along the Nakasen-do route to the west of Gifu Station for the most part.
Various railway lines such as Takayama Line, Taita Line, Chuo Main Line, Shinetsu Main Line and Takasaki Line have been built along the Nakasen-do route to the east of Gifu Station.
sen.cmt: west→eastに変更for the most partを削除

sen.j: しかし、いずれも東西の幹線という意味を持たず、太平洋側（関東地方、東海地方）・内陸側（甲信地方）・日本海側（北陸地方）の都市や村落を結ぶ、南北の連絡線や、東西の幹線の裏道というルートとなった。
sen.e: Nevertheless, none of these railway lines served the purpose as arterial railroad connecting east and west, and, rather, they functioned as south-north network lines or as secondary lines of the east-west main lines, connecting cities and rural communities within various regions such as the Pacific coastal areas (Kanto and Tokai regions), interiors (Koshin Region) and the Japan Sea coastal areas (Hokuriku Region).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Nevertheless, none of these railway lines served the purpose as arterial railroad connecting east and west, and, rather, they functioned as south-north network lines or as secondary lines of the east-west main lines, connecting cities and rural communities within various regions such as the Pacific coastal areas (Kanto and Tokai regions), interiors (Koshin Region) and the Japan Sea coastal areas (Hokuriku Region).

Nevertheless, none of these railway lines served the purpose as arterial railroad connecting east and west, and, rather, they functioned as south-north network lines or as secondary lines of the east-west main lines, connecting cities and rural communities within various regions such as the Pacific coastal areas (Kanto and Tokai Regions), interiors (Koshin Region) and the Japan Sea coastal areas (Hokuriku Region).

sen.j: 中山道ルートの内、和田峠 (長野県)を越える部分に当たる岩村田宿～下諏訪宿間については、並行する鉄道が建設されなかった。
sen.e: With respect to the area between Iwamurada-shuku and Shimosuwwa-juku straddling Wada-toge Pass (Nagano Prefecture), no railway was built to run parallel to Nakasen-do Road.
With respect to the area between Iwamurada-shuku and Shimosuwwa-juku straddling Wada-toge Pass (Nagano Prefecture), no railway was built to run parallel to Nakasen-do Road.
With respect to the area between Iwamurada-shuku and Shimosuwwa-juku straddling Wada-toge Pass (Nagano Prefecture), no railway was built to run parallel to Nakasen-do Road.

sen.j: それ以降、東京～下諏訪町間の内陸ルートは、中山道ルート（高崎市経由）ではなく、甲州街道ルート（甲府市経由）が主流となっており、下諏訪以西が中山道ルートとなっている。
sen.e: Since then, the Koshu Highway has been the main line for the interior corridor between Tokyo and Shimosuwa-machi and not the Nakasen-do route (via Takasaki City), whereas, the latter has been the mainstream for the area to the west of Shimosuwa.

Since then, the Koshu Highway has been the main line for the interior corridor between Tokyo and Shimosuwa-machi and not the Nakasen-do route (via Takasaki City), whereas, the latter has been the mainstream for the area to the west of Shimosuwa.

Since then, the Koshu Highway has been the main line for the interior corridor between Tokyo and Shimosuwa-machi and not the Nakasen-do route (via Takasaki City), whereas, the latter has been the mainstream for the area to the west of Shimosuwa.

sen.j: しかし、関東地方と近畿地方を結ぶ幹線を、東海道ルートではなく中山道ルートに建設しようという構想は、1950年代以後に国土開発幹線自動車道（国土縦貫自動車道）計画として再び現れた。
sen.e: The plan to construct the main artery connecting Kanto and Kinki regions along Nakasen-do Road and not Tokai-do Road, however, resurfaced as the National Highway Development Project after the 1950's.
The plan to construct the main artery connecting Kanto and Kinki regions along Nakasen-do Road and not Tokai-do Road, however, resurfaced as the National Highway Development Project after the 1950's.
The plan to construct the main artery connecting Kanto and Kinki regions along Nakasen-do Road and not Tokai-do Road, however, resurfaced as the National Highway Development Project after the 1950's.

sen.j: 中央自動車道は, おおむね甲州街道と併走し、岐阜県東濃地方で中山道と併走する。
sen.e: The Chuo Expressway was, for the most part, built along the Koshu Highway and runs parallel to Nakasen-do Road in Tono region of Gifu Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。また原文は非常に英訳が難しく、訳文の意味が難解になるため、僭越とは思いますがこのように言葉の並び替えをさせていただきました。
sen.e: The Chuo Expressway was, for the most part, built along the Koshu Highway and runs parallel to Nakasen-do Road in Tono region of Gifu Prefecture.
The Chuo Expressway was, for the most part, built along the Koshu Highway and runs parallel to Nakasen-do Road in Tono region of Gifu Prefecture.

sen.j: 中山道と併走する名神高速道路を正式には含んでおり（名神高速道路の法定名称は「中央自動車道西宮線」）、東京と西宮市を結ぶ東西の幹線になっている。
sen.e: It formally includes Meishin Expressway (which is legally referred to as the Chuo Expressway Nishinomiya Line) which runs parallel to Nakasen-do Road being the east-west main artery to connect Tokyo and Nishinomiya City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It formally includes Meishin Expressway (which is legally referred to as the Chuo Expressway Nishinomiya Line) which runs parallel to Nakasen-do Road being the east-west main artery to connect Tokyo and Nishinomiya City.

It formally includes Meishin Expressway (which is legally referred to as the Chuo Expressway Nishinomiya Line) which runs parallel to Nakasen-do Road being the main east-west artery to connect Tokyo and Nishinomiya City.

sen.j: また東京都と大阪市を結ぶ新幹線の建設を開始すべき新幹線鉄道の路線を定める基本計画として構想されている。
sen.e: The Nakasen-do corridor is visualized as the master plan for the new main line route to be built to connect Tokyo and Osaka.
The Nakasen-do corridor is visualized as the master plan for the new main line route to be built to connect Tokyo and Osaka.
The Nakasen-do corridor is visualized as the master plan for the new main line route to be built to connect Tokyo and Osaka.

sen.j: 東海道新幹線のバイパスとしての役割を担う中央新幹線も、同じく内陸部の甲州街道・中山道に併走する建設ルートが予定されている。
sen.e: Chuo Shinkansen which will play a role as a bypass for Tokaido Shinkansen is scheduled to be built along the Koshu Highway and Nakasen-do Road in interiors as well.
Chuo Shinkansen which will play a role as a bypass for Tokaido Shinkansen is scheduled to be built along the Koshu Highway and Nakasen-do Road in interiors as well.
Chuo Shinkansen which will play a role as a bypass for Tokaido Shinkansen is scheduled to be built along the Koshu Highway and Nakasen-do Road in interiors as well.

sen.j: 明治以後の急速な経済発展や、第二次世界大戦時の空襲などによって、沿道が急速に変貌した東海道沿線と異なり、中山道沿線では、江戸時代以前の街道や宿場町が比較的良く保存されて来た。
sen.e: Unlike areas along Tokai-do Road that went through a rapid transfiguration due to various factors such as the post-Meiji fast economic growth and air raids during the World War 2, the pre-Edo period highways and post-station towns have relatively been well preserved in areas along Nakasen-do Road.

Unlike areas along Tokai-do Road that went through a rapid transfiguration due to various factors such as the post-Meiji fast economic growth and air raids during the World War 2, the pre-Edo period highways and post-station towns have relatively been well preserved in areas along Nakasen-do Road.

Unlike areas along Tokai-do Road that went through a rapid transfiguration due to various factors such as the post-Meiji fast economic growth and air raids during World War II, the pre-Edo period highways and post-station towns have relatively been well preserved in areas along Nakasen-do Road.
sen.cmt: 「第二次世界大戦」の表記を変更

sen.j: 高度経済成長期以後、これらを積極的に保存しようという運動が高まった。
sen.e: After the high economic growth period, a movement to actively preserve these old highways and post station towns intensified.
After the high economic growth period, a movement to actively preserve these old highways and post station towns intensified.
After the high economic growth period, a movement to actively preserve these old highways and post station towns intensified.

sen.j: 特に、重要伝統的建造物群保存地区に選定された長野県の妻籠宿（1976年選定）と奈良井宿（1978年選定）が有名である。
sen.e: Tsumago-juku (designated in 1976) and Narai-juku (designated in 1978) in Nagano that have been designated among the Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings are particularly well known.

Tsumago-juku (designated in 1976) and Narai-juku (designated in 1978) in Nagano that have been designated among the Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings are particularly well known.

Tsumago-juku (designated in 1976) and Narai-juku (designated in 1978) in Nagano Prefecture that have been designated among the Preservation Districts for Groups of Historic Buildings are particularly well known.

sen.j: 他にも、かつての宿場町ではそれぞれ歴史資料館などを整備している。
sen.e: Additionally, each of the former post station towns has developed its own historic museum and the other related tourist attractions.
Additionally, each of the former post station towns has developed its own historic museum and the other related tourist attractions.
Additionally, each of the former post station towns has developed its own historic museum and other related tourist attractions.

sen.j: また、奈良井宿と藪原宿の間にあり、日本海（信濃川水系）と太平洋（木曽川水系）の中央分水嶺でもある鳥居峠 (長野県)や、妻籠宿と馬籠宿の間にある馬籠峠では、自然遊歩道としての整備が進められている。
sen.e: At Torii-toga Pass (Nagano Prefecture) situated between Narai-juku and Yabuhara-juku, dividing Japan Sea (the Shinano River System) from Pacific Ocean (the Kiso River System) and Magome-toge Pass located between Tsumago-u and Magome-juku, maintenance work is currently underway to turn part of Nakasen-do Road into nature walks.

At Torii-toga Pass (Nagano Prefecture) situated between Narai-juku and Yabuhara-juku, dividing Japan Sea (the Shinano River System) from Pacific Ocean (the Kiso River System) and Magome-toge Pass located between Tsumago-u and Magome-juku, maintenance work is currently underway to turn part of Nakasen-do Road into nature walks.

At Torii-toge Pass (Nagano Prefecture) situated between Narai-juku and Yabuhara-juku, dividing the Japan Sea (the Shinano River System) from the Pacific Ocean (the Kiso River System) and Magome-toge Pass located between Tsumago-juku and Magome-juku, maintenance work is currently underway to turn the pathes into nature trails.
sen.cmt: 「鳥居峠」のスペルミスを修正「妻籠宿」のスペルミスを修正後半部分を変更冠詞

sen.j: 中山道は、約30の大名が参勤交代に利用したと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that approximately 30 daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) used Nakasen-do Road to travel under the Sankinkotai system (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo).

It is said that approximately 30 daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) used Nakasen-do Road to travel under the Sankinkotai system (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo).

It is said that approximately 30 daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) used Nakasen-do Road to travel under the Sankinkotai system (a system under which feudal lords in the Edo period were required to spend every other year in residence in Edo).

sen.j: その中で最大の領地を持つ加賀藩は、江戸の上屋敷を中山道沿いの本郷 (文京区)に、下屋敷を板橋宿に置いた。
sen.e: The Kaga clan which had a largest territory among daimyo had its kamiyashiki (daimyo's regular residence) in Edo in the Hongo area (Bunkyo Ward) on Nakasen-do Road and a villa in the suburban Itabashi-juku.

The Kaga clan which had a largest territory among daimyo had its kamiyashiki (daimyo's regular residence) in Edo in the Hongo area (Bunkyo Ward) on Nakasen-do Road and a villa in the suburban Itabashi-juku.

Kaga Domain which had the largest territory among daimyo had its kamiyashiki (daimyo's regular residence) in Edo in the Hongo area (Bunkyo Ward) on Nakasen-do Road and its shimoyashiki (daimyo's suburban residence) in Itabashi-juku.
sen.cmt: a largest→the largestに変更「下屋敷」以降の部分を変更「藩」の訳を統一用語集に合わせて変更

sen.j: そのうち、江戸上屋敷の敷地は、明治以後に東京大学となった。
sen.e: The property of the Kaga clan kamiyashiki in Edo subsequently turned into the campus of Tokyo University since the Meiji Era.
The property of the Kaga clan kamiyashiki in Edo subsequently turned into the campus of Tokyo University since the Meiji Era.
The property of the Kaga Domain's kamiyashiki in Edo subsequently turned into the campus of Tokyo University since the Meiji Era.
sen.cmt: 「藩」の訳を統一用語集に合わせて変更

sen.j: そのため、現在の東京大学の本郷キャンパスは国道17号に面している。
sen.e: The present Hongo Campus of Tokyo University consequently is facing Route 17.
The present Hongo Campus of Tokyo University consequently is facing Route 17.
The present Hongo Campus of Tokyo University consequently is facing Route 17.

sen.j: また、かつての中山道に向かう形で、金沢藩上屋敷の赤門が、重要文化財として保存展示されている。
sen.e: Additionally, Akamon (the Red Gate) of the main residence of the Kanazawa Clan in Edo which stands facing the old Nakasen-do Road has been preserved and on display as an Important Cultural Property.
Additionally, Akamon (the Red Gate) of the main residence of the Kanazawa Clan in Edo which stands facing the old Nakasen-do Road has been preserved and on display as an Important Cultural Property.
Additionally, Akamon (the Red Gate) of the main residence of Kanazawa Domain in Edo which stands facing the old Nakasen-do Road has been preserved and on display as an Important Cultural Property.
sen.cmt: 「藩」の訳を統一用語集に合わせて変更

sen.j: 中山道は、様々な文学作品の舞台ともなった。
sen.e: Nakasen-do Road has been used as a background for various literary works.
Nakasen-do Road has been used as a background for various literary works.
Nakasen-do Road has been used as a background for various literary works.

sen.j: 馬籠出身の島崎藤村は、自らの故郷を舞台に歴史小説「夜明け前」を執筆した。
sen.e: The Magome native Toson SHIMAZAKI wrote the historical fiction Yoake-mae (Before the Dawn) with his home town being its background.
The Magome native Toson SHIMAZAKI wrote the historical fiction Yoake-mae (Before the Dawn) with his home town being its background.
The Magome native Toson SHIMAZAKI wrote the historical fiction Yoake-mae (Before the Dawn) with his home town being its background.

sen.j: 現在の馬籠宿には、「藤村記念館」などが建設されている。
sen.e: Monuments such as the Toson Memorial Museum have been built in the present Magome-juku.
Monuments such as the Toson Memorial Museum have been built in the present Magome-juku.
Monuments such as the Toson Memorial Museum have been built in the present Magome-juku.
